title: Checking Mail Server Capabilities
content:
This version is very slow when opened ... it seaches through for various emails (gmail and Outlook) and snags on something called 'Checking Mail Server Capabilities'. Other issues include a slow copy to the Send folder once an email has been sent. I am not a technical person, been using TBird for many years and until now have really enjoyed its capabilities

Is there a known related issue? Overall the performance is very poor ... I use a series 7 processor and have WiFi speeds in excess of 100 MB.

Thanks Ron

title: aggiornamento 146
content: avevo creato una struttura con circa 40 cartelle dove veniva distribuita la posta di ogni singolo account pop3, mediante applicazione di filtri. Dopo aggiornamento a 146, tutte le cartelle locali sono state rinominate nello stesso modo: "Archivi". Ora mi ritrovo con 40 cartelle con lo stesso nome dove andare a cercare la posta arrivata e TB non mi consente di modificare il nome (anche da proprietà), ne di cancellarle. Ho provato con la funzione ripara cartella, anche da modalità offline e risoluzione errore. Esiste un modo per: 1 ripristinare la 145 2 rinominare correttamente le cartelle locali, arbitrariamente modificate da TB In attesa cordialità
creator: ianfer

title: Calendar event context menu has Edit grayed out
content:
Hello,

I accept Teams events over the email, but cannot join them because the Join Meeting hyperlink is removed in the event's description. When I try to edit the event's description manually, the Edit option in the event's context menu (right click) is grayed out as can be seen in the attached picture. I also did not find any other way to change the event's description to insert the Teams meeting URL.

How do I fully edit events, including description and event dates? I need to have calendar events based on Teams meeting invitations work out-of-the-box. How do I achieve this?

Note: Exporting an individual calendar event would also help me solve this problem, but I don't think such a feature exists. If there would be, I would have exported the broken event, correct it manually, delete the old one from Thunderbird, open the event with Thunderbird and then add back the corrected version.

Thank you, Razvan Chisa
creator: ronnyourmatrix

content:

I have spent a large number of hours trying to self-help, but alas, I am at my wits end. At this point in time I have two folders named Archives, one with all my messages and one that is empty. I even uninstalled and downloaded Thunderbird onto my Windows 11 desktop PC. Anyone care to help an old IT software developer? My objective it to somehow get back to having only one All Mail folder

Thanks, Brad
creator: bpyoung001

title: Global Search > "Show results as list" > right-click > context menu has two problems: (1) redundant dividers, and (2) submenu of "Tag" is incomplete.
content:
Steps to reproduce the problems:

Perform a Global Search (ctrl + K). Search for any string. Just make sure there is at least one search result. > Click "Show results as list". > Right-click on the search result in the Message List Pane. (Please see the footnote.) > The pop-up context menu has two problems:

(1) There are redundant dividers. (Please see the first attached image.)

(2) Hover the mouse over "Tag". The pop-up submenu is incomplete. The menu includes "New Tag" and "Manage Tags". However, "Remove All Tags", "Important", "Work", "Personal", "To Do" and "Later" are missing. (Please see the second attached image.)

---

These problems (redundant dividers and incomplete submenu) also occur in Troubleshoot Mode.

---

These problems only occur after using Global Search and clicking "Show results as list".

If I right-click a message in the Message List Pane of a regular folder (such as the "Inbox" folder or "Templates" folder), the pop-up context menu displays correctly: There are no redundant dividers, and the submenu of "Tag" is complete. (Please see the third attached image.)

---

Operating system: Windows 10.

Versions of Thunderbird: 140.3.1esr and 140.6.0esr. I was using 140.3.1esr, and currently I am using 140.6.0esr. Both versions have the same problems.

---

Footnote: When I right-click on the search result in the Message List Pane, the following error messages display in the Error Console (please see the fourth attached image): 

Uncaught NS_ERROR_FAILURE: Component returned failure code: 0x80004005 (NS_ERROR_FAILURE) [nsIMsgDBView.getThreadContainingIndex]        mailCommon.js:647     isCommandEnabled chrome://messenger/content/mailCommon.js:647     fillMailContextMenu chrome://messenger/content/mailContext.js:340     onPopupShowing chrome://messenger/content/mailContext.js:146     handleEvent chrome://messenger/content/mailContext.js:133     _onContextMenu chrome://messenger/content/about3Pane.js:5235     handleEvent chrome://messenger/content/about3Pane.js:4758     init chrome://messenger/content/about3Pane.js:4712     async* chrome://messenger/content/about3Pane.js:170     async* chrome://messenger/content/about3Pane.js:139

---

The fifth attached image shows mailCommon.js:647.
creator: dqtimrykfv
